scenarioDescription:
The HD 240237 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 240237 is a star with 8.76 times the mass of the Sun, and 71.23 times its radius. It is located 3044.27 light years away from the solar system.

HD 240237 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 240237 system


HD 240237 b

HD 240237 b was discovered by the McDonald Observatory observatory, in 2012-01, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.92 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 240237 b is 5053.020 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 240237 b is 12.200 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 240237 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 240237, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the McDonald Observatory.
name: HD 240237 - System With 1 Exoplanet
